subject: Climate & Environment
title: Pollution and Biodiversity
description: Learn Pollution and Biodiversity in one minute.

hook.text: DDT nearly wiped out bald eagles. Their eggshells thinned so much they cracked under the mother.

buildup.text: Pesticides, plastics, and chemicals accumulate in food chains â€” a process called bioaccumulation.

discovery.text: Top predators get the highest doses because toxins concentrate at each step up the chain.

twist.text: Microplastics are now found inside plankton, the base of the ocean food web.

climax.text: Banning DDT saved the bald eagle. But newer chemicals enter use faster than we can test them.

punchline.text: What we put into the environment comes back to us through the food chain.

quiz.question: What is bioaccumulation?
options: Toxins concentrating as they move up the food chain
Animals growing larger in polluted areas
